```{r setup, include=FALSE}
vb<-read.csv("viborka_10000_chist.csv",sep=',')
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
hor<-read.csv("horoshie_chist.csv",sep=',')
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
```{r}
horx<-data.matrix(hor)
vbx<-data.matrix(vb)
totx<-rbind(horx,vbx)
totx[is.na(totx)==TRUE]<-0
totf<-data.frame(totx)
```

```{r}
pca<-princomp(totf)
pca1<-prcomp(totf)
```
```{r}
library(FactoMineR)
result<-PCA(totf)
```
```{r}
library(psych)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggbiplot)
fit2<-principal(totf,nfactors = 5)
```
```{r}
fit <- princomp(totf, cor=TRUE)
summary(fit)
biplot(fit,choices = c(2,4),ylim=c(-0.3,0.1))
xxx<-fit$scores
#lines(xxx[10001:10192,2],xxx[10001:10192,4],col="green",type = "p")
x[1:10194]<-1
x[10000:10194]<-2
cl<-as.factor(x)
ggplot(totf, aes(xxx[,1],xxx[,2], color = cl))+geom_point()+labs ( colour = " ластеры" )
```
```{r}
fit12 <- principal(totf, nfactors=5, rotate="varimax")
x<-fit12
plot(x$scores)
vv<-x$scores
plot(x$scores)
lines(vv[1:10000,1],vv[1:10000,2],col="red",type = "p")
lines(vv[10000:10192,1],vv[10000:10192,2],col="green",type = "p")
```
